slide.title: Attachments API

list.blurb: Encapsulates data to serialize to SOAP.

list.bullet: Arg 4 Optional: String: File (actual contents of file or data to be sent)

slide.blurb: If you only specify the filename, the SOAP_Attachment class will attempt to read the file into memory and send the data. DIME is the default attachment method if the 'attachments' option is not defined.
slide.example:
<?php
$filename = 'attachment.php';
$v =  new SOAP_Attachment('test','text/plain',$filename);
$methodValue = new SOAP_Value('testattach', 'Struct', array($v));

$client = new SOAP_Client('mailto:user@domain.com');
# calling with mime
$resp = $client->call('echoMimeAttachment',array($v),
                array('attachments'=>'Mime',
                    'namespace'=>'http://soapinterop.org/',
                    'from'=>'user@domain.com',
                    'host'=>'smtp.domain.com'));
?>
